Name: GEDCO’s North East Food Pantry
Description:
GEDCO's North East Food Pantry serves individuals in crisis by connecting customers with emergency food relief that will enable movement towards self-sufficiency. The heart and compassion of this entirely volunteer-run program drives them to ensure that everyone leaves with food.  

The North East Food Pantry is open five days a week.Hours:Monday - Friday 10:30am - 1:30pm

Name: Moveable Feast
Description:
We meet our clients where they are. For most people, that means delivering healthy meals directly to their doorsteps. But some people with life-threatening illnesses are homeless - they have no doorsteps of their own - and over 50% of homeless citizens are at high risk for HIV/AIDS and other chronic medical conditions.

Name: Donald Bentley Food Pantry
Description:
Local food pantry established in memory of Donald Bentley
Mission
In addition to keeping Bentley's memory alive, the pantry seeks to benefit the needy living in Baltimore, specifically those in the 21202 and 21218 zip codes.

top this, 64,000 of those children are five or under.

Name: Carroll County Food Sunday
Description:
Carroll County Food Sunday (CCFS) is a non-profit organization of volunteers and members of the community coming together as neighbors helping neighbors by supporting Carroll County residents in meeting their emergency and supplemental food needs.
HOURS:

Tues, Wed, Thurs: 10:00-11:15 and 1:00-2:15

Sat:  9:00-11:15
Our program aims to sustain health, good

Name: Shepherd\'s Staff
Description:
Provides non-perishable food on an emergency basis and also has infant formula. as available. In Summer, may have produce. Call to see what's available. If food is not available, will refer individuals to Food Sunday in the Human Services building.

Event specific dates on flyers and materials will be updated before the upcoming event date.

-   The Shepherd's Table Soup

Name: Carroll County Salvation Army
Description: Offers non-perishable and perishable food items to individuals in need. Mustprovide proper identification, proof of income and proof of need.

Name: Midcounty United Ministries
Description: MUM's clients come from zip codes 20902, 20906, 20895, 20896, and 20853. While Montgomery County is one of the most affluent counties in the nation, a large number of the working poor reside in the Aspen Hill (20906) and Wheaton (20902) sections of Silver Spring.
